summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an unknown recipient, recommending a paralegal who is interested in working on sex trafficking cases for potential assignment to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, recommending a paralegal for potential work on the Epstein case.

persons.name: Paralegal
persons.context: An unnamed paralegal who is interested in working on sex trafficking cases and is being recommended for potential assignment to the Epstein case.

connections.description: The Assistant United States Attorney is recommending the paralegal for potential work on the Epstein case.

events.title: Email recommending paralegal for Epstein case
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney sends an email recommending a paralegal interested in sex trafficking cases for potential assignment to the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The email is dated January 18, 2019, indicating ongoing legal activity related to the Epstein case at that time.
A paralegal expressed interest in working on sex trafficking cases, and was being recommended for the Epstein case.
The correspondence originated from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York.
